title: From Bosnia and Dresden to Spain’s ‘ghost airport’ – new UK air routes launching this winter
text:
Want to discover a new destination this winter? We’ve trawled dozens of airline schedules to uncover some of the most enticing options.

Southend to… Bucharest, Sibiu, Treviso and Vilnius

These are exciting times for Southend Airport. Passenger numbers rose by 35.5 per cent last year, on top of a 24.9 per cent rise in 2017, and new routes are coming this winter courtesy of Wizz Air, based in Hungary, and Ryanair.

Wizz will be offering its first services from the Essex hub, to Vilnius (from Nov 23), Bucharest (Nov 22) and Sibiu (Oct 30). Vilnius, the Lithuanian capital, is famed for its low prices and vast medieval old town. Bucharest, the Romanian capital, offers imposing Soviet-era architecture, hipster coffee spots and green spaces. Sibiu, also in Romania, is the gateway to Transylvania, one of Europe’s most bucolic regions.
